page.title: 18A SHILLINGSTONE SCHOOLBOY
page.content: Its a very nice life to be a Shillingstone schoolboy. My favourite lessons are History and Science.Our classroom was built in 1975,just after our Headtaecher came.Our Head is called Mrs.Ashcroft.She is a nice person and teaches interesting things.The two older classrooms which are the library and the hall were built in 1885. Our school field was once a hay field with cows,but now its got footballs and boys running up and down. Out of our window we can see the church and Hambledon Hill.Hambledon is a hill about 1.5 miles away. Just before you get to Hambledon you see the railway.The railways out of use and the rails are not there, but it makes a good walk.In the evening you might see some wildlife. J.Edwards
